sentences: Don Henry (born December 30, 1959 in San Jose, California) is an American country music singer and songwriter.
His career took off when the Kathy Mattea single "Where've You Been", which he co-wrote with Jon Vezner, won numerous awards in 1990 and 1991.
In 1991, he released his first solo album, Wild in the Backyard, which was engineered and produced by Ray Kennedy.
Writing in Entertainment Weekly, Alanna Nash gave the album a B+ grade and described Henry as "One of Nashvilleâ€™s best young tunesmiths".
He performs with Jon Vezner as The Don Juans; they accompanied Tom Paxton on his 2018 and 2019 UK tours.
